head.supplied: Public Lands Office, ¶ Melbourne ¶ 31st Jany 1859. ¶ Memo./ ¶ ¶ We, the undersigned having inspected certain drawings of Natural History specimens &c, and M.S.S submitted by Mr William Blandowski, th...

div.p: 59/608 in 70/13610, unit 470, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: MS annotation by Ligar: 'Mr Morrah Have this kept for a record. Ch.W.L 1 Feby /59'. The cover sheet in the file records that the letter was registered on 4 February 1859 and is annotated: 'Forwarded for the information of Capt. Pasley Ch.W.L.17/2/59'. Public Lands Office,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: We, the undersigned having inspected certain drawings of Natural History specimens &c, and M.S.S submitted by Mr William Blandowski, through Dr Sconce, to the Surveyor General give it as our opinion that they are, in their present unfinished state not of high scientific value to the Government.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
